title: Public Procurement Entity Type Vocabulary
description: Domain-specific refinement of CEP entity types for buyers, suppliers, procedures, awards, contracts, and implementation records in public procurement.

terms.label: Buyer Organization
terms.definition: A public body or contracting authority that initiates and runs procurement procedures and enters into contracts as the buyer.

terms.label: Supplier Organization
terms.definition: An economic operator, company, nonprofit, or other organization that participates in procurement procedures as a tenderer or contractor.

terms.label: Procurement Procedure
terms.definition: A procurement process or procedure, including its type, scope, and governing rules, under which notices, tenders, awards, and contracts are managed.

terms.label: Procurement Lot
terms.definition: A subdivision of a procurement procedure that groups related goods, works, or services and may be awarded separately to one or more suppliers.

terms.label: Award
terms.definition: An entity representing the decision to award a contract or lot to one or more suppliers, including associated values and conditions.

terms.label: Contract
terms.definition: A legally binding agreement resulting from a procurement procedure or award, including its terms, duration, values, and performance conditions.

terms.label: Implementation Record
terms.definition: An entity capturing contract implementation information such as payments, delivery milestones, amendments, and completion status.

terms.label: Other Procurement Entity
terms.definition: A procurement-related entity that does not fit another, more specific category in this vocabulary but is needed for CEP procurement graphs.
